Audio Description: On a dark green and black background a grim-faced, square-jawed soldier turns his head to look sternly out at the viewer in this poster about national security. He is dressed in a brown jacket, open at the neck and a helmet with the chinstraps hanging freely on either side of his face. His strong left hand grips a rifle with a bayonet. A light coming from the right of the picture highlights his hand and his face. In a black band at the top of the poster are the words “The battle-wise infantryman…” in white letters. At the bottom a red band with white letters says “is careful of what he says or writes, how about you?”
Creator: United States. War Department. Army Service Forces. Adjutant General's Office
Description: Poster, 50.85 x 71.1 cm, artist: Jes Wilhelm Schlaikjer
